page.title: 15MOLESEY LOCK
page.content: { Molesey Lock}is situated on the River Thames just upstream from Hampton Court Palace. It was{built in 1815}bacause in the summer the river often dried out, and as most of the goods sold in London were transported by river trade was affected. The lock-keeper operates the lock by turning a handle and opening the gates. When it is closed with boats inside the man lets the water out until it is at the same level as the water under Hampton Court Bridge. He opens the gates and the boats go on their journey. { Small boats like canoes can use the {rollers at the side of the lock.} In the summer many people holiday on the river and the lock is very busy.
